comment.author: 83429206@N06
comment._content: The modern day town of Te Awamutu grew on the site of Ōtāwhao mission station, which was established by the Church Missionary Society in 1841. In 1864 the mission station became the headquarters of Liet-General Duncan Cameron during the New Zealand Wars: www.nzhistory.net.nz/media/photo/teasdale-nz-wars-memorial
